verses.text: Manasseh \add was\add* twelve years old when he began to reign , and he reigned fifty and five years in Jerusalem :

But did \add that which was\add* evil in the sight of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, like unto the abominations of the heathen , whom the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* had cast out before the children of Israel. \p

¶ For he built again the high places which Hezekiah his father had broken down , and he reared up altars for Baalim , and made groves , and worshipped all the host of heaven , and served them.\f + \fr 33.3 \ft he built…: Heb. he returned and built\f*

Also he built altars in the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, whereof the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* had said , In Jerusalem shall my name be for ever.
And he built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

And he caused his children to pass through the fire in the valley of the son of Hinnom : also he observed times , and used enchantments , and used witchcraft , and dealt with a familiar spirit , and with wizards : he wrought much evil in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, to provoke him to anger.

And he set a carved image , the idol which he had made , in the house of God , of which God had said to David and to Solomon his son , In this house , and in Jerusalem , which I have chosen before all the tribes of Israel , will I put my name for ever :

Neither will I any more remove the foot of Israel from out of the land which I have appointed for your fathers ; so that they will take heed to do all that I have commanded them, according to the whole law and the statutes and the ordinances by the hand of Moses.
So Manasseh made Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem to err , \add and\add* to do worse than the heathen , whom the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had destroyed before the children of Israel.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* spake to Manasseh , and to his people : but they would not hearken. \p

¶ Wherefore the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* brought upon them the captains of the host of the king of Assyria , which took Manasseh among the thorns , and bound him with fetters , and carried him to Babylon.\f + \fr 33.11 \ft of the king: Heb. which were the king’s\f*\f + \fr 33.11 \ft fetters: or, chains\f*
And when he was in affliction , he besought the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* his God , and humbled himself greatly before the God of his fathers ,

And prayed unto him: and he was intreated of him, and heard his supplication , and brought him again to Jerusalem into his kingdom. Then Manasseh knew that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* he \add was\add* God.

Now after this he built a wall without the city of David , on the west side of Gihon , in the valley , even to the entering in at the fish gate , and compassed about Ophel , and raised it up a very great height , and put captains of war in all the fenced cities of Judah.\f + \fr 33.14 \ft Ophel: or, the tower\f*

And he took away the strange gods , and the idol out of the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and all the altars that he had built in the mount of the house of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and in Jerusalem , and cast \add them\add* out of the city.

And he repaired the altar of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and sacrificed thereon peace offerings and thank offerings , and commanded Judah to serve the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of Israel.
Nevertheless the people did sacrifice still in the high places , \add yet\add* unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* their God only. \p

¶ Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh , and his prayer unto his God , and the words of the seers that spake to him in the name of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of Israel , behold, they \add are written\add* in the book of the kings of Israel.

His prayer also, and \add how God\add* was intreated of him, and all his sin , and his trespass , and the places wherein he built high places , and set up groves and graven images , before he was humbled : behold, they \add are\add* written among the sayings of the seers.\f + \fr 33.19 \ft the seers: or, Hosai\f* \p
¶ So Manasseh slept with his fathers , and they buried him in his own house : and Amon his son reigned in his stead. \p
¶ Amon \add was\add* two and twenty years old when he began to reign , and reigned two years in Jerusalem.

But he did \add that which was\add* evil in the sight of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, as did Manasseh his father : for Amon sacrificed unto all the carved images which Manasseh his father had made , and served them;

And humbled not himself before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, as Manasseh his father had humbled himself; but Amon trespassed more and more.\f + \fr 33.23 \ft trespassed more and more: Heb. multiplied trespass\f*
And his servants conspired against him, and slew him in his own house. \p
¶ But the people of the land slew all them that had conspired against king Amon ; and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his stead.
